website_summaries.verdict: A great concept for protecting items like bikes and grills from the elements, but it lacks the durability and security of models made of stronger materials.
pros: Made of heavy-duty plastic that's flexibly yet protective in bad weather
cons: Though the material is rugged, it is prone to tears
It's not likely to last as long as solid plastic or resin models

customer_reviews.title: Very well made bike tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very thick. It feels like it will last a long time. First wind storm is hitting us now and it is standing firm. I fit two bikes in it with my vehicle rack.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: best thing ever i have 3 bikes and 3 chairs and 2 charcoals, the big bags and a fish tank pump, and some other random stuff. i love this storage so much. then when u want to put it away it folds into a small bag. how neat is that. what i did was get a piece of cardboard, actually the one it was shipped in and cut a piece out to put on the bottom of the storage just to make sure it didnt get any rips, and to keep it clean. i would recommend this to anyone who needs extra space. Heavy duty plastic.
customer_reviews.author: lexi

customer_reviews.title: but it wasn't easy. My husband is tall
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a lifesaver for us. We put it on our <unused> back porch when we ran out of space to store our bikes in our garage. We managed to get two adult and one kids bike in there, but it wasn't easy. My husband is tall, and his bike barely fit in width wise (he's 6'3"). It is made with high quality materials. Durable construction. A nice solution overall. But not as easy to take bikes in and out on a regular basis if you have three of them.
customer_reviews.author: SFSH

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, it fits 2 road bikes and my baby's ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, it fits 2 road bikes and my baby's stroller. Keeps them dry from rain and snow I have no backyard so I'm using it in the roof (my patio) Used a couple of beams for base and it works great stay in windy weather and snow
customer_reviews.author: Delfino Melchor

customer_reviews.title: Great durability! We left the yardstash assembled with a ...
customer_reviews.text: It survived Hurricane Irma in Key West!! Great durability! We left the yardstash assembled with a couple trashcans inside (we took our bikes in the house just in case). It is anchored to the pavers and to a cement wall with bolts. We returned today after evacuating to find that many of our trees are broken and in the pool, but the yardstash looks like nothing happened. It fits our two beach cruiser bicycles (one with a basket on the back) with no issues. A great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian G Wagstaff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, looks great
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a really small (heavy) box; it's amazing how they fit it all in there. The installation instructions were quite easy to understand as long as you had the YardStash IV unfurled in front of you. I was able to install it all on my own (middle aged woman, somewhat handy, but not a superstar) in less than an hour. Two adult racing bikes (propped up by the Bikehand Rear Hub Mount Bike Stand) and a child's bike (with kick-stand) fit perfectly in the YardStash IV with room to spare for a bike pump and gardening tools. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks flimsy but has held up very good. Still good choice after 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Was not sure it would hold up in the Florida weather but since early spring last year it has done well. I have it on the side of my house in the backyard and store the grandkids bikes, scooters and other outdoor play items
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-bicycle storage.
customer_reviews.text: Needed storage for 2 adult bikes.... they fit easily. Plus can also fit a decent sized heavy duty for container for charcoal, e.t.c. Fabric is much stronger than other portable units I've found. It has been thoroughly waterproof, even in big thunderstorms. Have only had it for around 3 months so am unsure of ability to withstand sun damage, but would assume it would do well as the fabric is thick & sturdy. Wish it were slightly larger by about 4-6 inches each direction & came in dark beige or brown color.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy V.

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in high humidity, rain, and wind.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent to store our bikes while in Key West, FL due to the high humidity and salt air. It’s holding up real well through 40+ mph winds and heavy rain as well as the harsh sun and heat. This is saving our bikes from getting rusty. I’ve had it for about 2 months now. We did add some tie down straps to all four corners and staked to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble but not sure two bikes would really fit
customer_reviews.text: Some folks have posted that it is difficult to put together, but if you have ever put a tent up, it is essentially the same thing - except that the weight of the material is a bit more difficult for getting cross poles in. I did it myself easily but a second pair of hands just to stabilize it would have been helpful. NOTE: I have a full sized bike and it fits in nicely, but I am not sure that two bikes would really work. For me, that is fine, but if you have two bikes, it could be really tight. Now I am waiting for a good rain to see how it works!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Quality Storage With Confidence
customer_reviews.text: This superior product exceeded my expectations in every possible way. I so appreciate the ease of assembly and the quality of construction. In fact, I liked the first one so much that I ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and holding up well.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy and material is holding up well after a month in the sun and a few rain storms. Although I've noticed when I open the yard stash up a day or two after a good soaking rain, water seeps in from somewhere. Not sure if the water is pooling up around the zipper and leaking in after zipping open, but it's a decent sized puddle that accumulates. I don't think the water leaks when closed up though. It definitely seems to seep in when I'm zipping it open. The exterior hasn't shown any fade or wear yet. I only have a road bike with stand and it fits with plenty of space to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zippers that break
customer_reviews.text: Zipper sucks. Zipper broke after a few uses. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyMD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike storage.
customer_reviews.text: Better and cheaper than a shed. Perfect for my two hybrid bikes. Easy to set up by one person. I had to set it up in a flat area away from where it was to be finally placed. I was able to carry it by myself when it was fully assembled. I put a piece of plywood on top of an old yoga mat as flooring because I needed to use the bikes kickstands. Wasn't near a fence or wall to lean against, as the instructions suggest. Neat side opening pocket if you need to chain bikes to fence etc.
customer_reviews.author: AK-SS

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke after only about six times opening and closing.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, but the zipper gets stuck when opening or closing the "door" on the extra material sticking out where the zipper was sewn to the vinyl. This excess material gets caught in the zipper every time I try to open or close the "door". Well today the zipper broke after it got stuck on the material and I attempted to free the zipper. I would recommend trimming the extra material from the zipper seam before assembly. Not an easy job, but one the manufacturer should have done or they should adjust the manufacturing procedure so there is no vinyl material getting caught in the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyGearStick

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver by allowing outside storage in all types of weather.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver to provide a small, covered space for us to store our bikes in rain and snow. We're successfully able to put one adult and two kid bikes in here, and most likely can fit two adults with a smaller bike as well. To make it work, important to put weights (bricks, heavy objects) in the corners and tie down ends to ensure it does not blow over. Ours is located next to a metal shelving unit and drain pipe - we used bungee cords to secure each back pole to either the shelf or drain pipe. Easy to access for our kids too.
customer_reviews.author: HLD

customer_reviews.title: Great for protecting bikes
customer_reviews.text: We live in California where the sun is brutal in the summer and the winter rain will ruin bikes. The storage shed tent is perfect. We put it up against our house so it is somewhat protected. It isn't fastened down and we had a pretty good wind storm. The shed held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to assemble bike storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, easily assembled tent. The fabric is thick and we are storing 2 adult bikes in it. We have had it for 2 months and while it is in a protected area next to our house, it has held up well during several storms. The real test will be our hot Arizona summer, but it does have a vent, so I suspect it will do fine. It has a neat, tidy appearance. So far, we are very pleased to have an easily accessible place to keep our bikes clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: CJR

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy to be practical. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: The product did not survive the winter. Use only in areas with no heavy precipitation. Construction is very flimsy. Can not withstand heavy rain or snow. The frame bents out of shape very easily.
customer_reviews.author: A. B

customer_reviews.title: Have two people to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Have an extra person on standby to hold while you are putting this together. I did it by myself in about 30 minutes but would have been done sooner if it wasn't for wind (i live on the beach). UPDATE: 6/17/2020 this is NOT sturdy. We've had some very mild rain and wind coming through VA the last couple days and the stakes have been pulled up from the ground. Mind you I hammered these stakes in as well as packed them with dirt. overall just a very Flimsy "foundation".
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Store Tons of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this to store household goods. The zipper closes down all the way and only leaves a really tiny hole. When I compare the volume of space you get with the YardStash, it's a steal. Feel free to compare it, by volume, to plastic storage containers. You are getting a lot more for your money. In addition, once a month I throw a handful of mothballs into the tent as an extra precaution to keep critters out. So far, not a single critter inside. I'm considering purchasing a second one.
customer_reviews.author: XO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble... provides dry, clean storage
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to assemble and two adult bikes easily fit fit inside. However, one of the grommets on the bottom side literally fell out, so I wasn’t able to use that one, but adjusted to use the other one on that side. I have it under the deck sitting on a concrete slab, so I’m going to wrap up a couple concrete pier blocks and put them inside the Yardstash to keep it in place if the wind gets going. I’m happy with it and glad to have a clean, dry place to store bikes. Not sure what “SHEERNESS” means!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Works great in all weather
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our needs. It's keeping out all of the rain and snow and we live in the far northern reaches of New York. It easily fit two adult bikes and quite a lot of other items. We're really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Zeek

customer_reviews.title: Very well made! Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it a couple of months now. Love it. Another reviewer said they put a folding table in the bottom for a floor. I had one and it fit perfectly. I put a set of plastic shelves in one end. My 20” lawn mower goes in and out easily. I set it up against the back of my house for some protection from wind. I also added 4 plastic fence poles for extra peace of mind. The plastic is extra thick and the zipper works well. A friend and I easily put it up. Only gripe is I wish it was gray or brown.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Very cool tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent to store my electric scooter and it is perfect. Most bike covers were too short so my kickstand and some spokes were starting to rust. This will prevent that. We get pretty strong winds on the coast so I had a piece of plywood cut for a floor and more stabilization. I secured it to my fence with heavy duty zip ties. Love that it has hooks inside to hang helmets or other stuff. It is VERY heavy duty, more so than a person tent. VERY happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Silver Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Was looking for an option to store several bales of ...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an option to store several bales of hay for my horse. I built a pallet for the floor and can put over ten bales of alfalfa in there for dry storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the III
customer_reviews.text: I had the YardStash III, and I'm pretty sure the IV did not exist when I bought the III, otherwise I would have bought the IV. The III lasted about 2 years in southern California sun before it ripped. I was sad, because I have to store my bikes outside, and it cost me approx. $65/yr to store these bikes with the III. Thankfully I saw this was available and it is far superior in material grade. I feel very confident in the protection it's providing my bikes outside. Hopefully this lasts 5+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Stratos

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: A bit too pricey but, has lasted through a very wet spring and hot humid summer along the mid-atlantic. It has a humidity flap but, the metal parts on my carbon road bike have some rust on them so I don't use this for my bikes anymore as originally purchased. Also, even when completely sealed up I still found a puddle of water inside.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically to store 2 bikes. The unit definitely needs 2 people to assemble easily. Both bikes fit, but have to be back to front. It's a bit of effort to put them both in and take them out, but definitely works as long as it isn't a daily routine
customer_reviews.author: tucker

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, simple, usable and moveable
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular. We needed a quick and simple way to store bicycles and camping equipment that doesn’t require pouring concrete, can be easily setup and moved and is truly waterproof. These are perfect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LAH

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We use these to store all our outdoor cushions in at a lake house. They work great!!! They seal tightly so no water gets in them, and they keep all the bugs and spiders off our cushions. The cushion stay clean and dry so they last longer! I was skeptical when my husband bought our first one. I had always used those Rubbermaid chests to store our cushions in before, but they always seemed to leak and the squirrels would chew on the corners. These yard stash tents were the answer to my storage dilemma!
customer_reviews.author: PDL

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago, and it's held up well in rain, snow, and heat (that's Colorado for you). We just needed a place outside to store the bikes since our spare room is being converted into a nursery now. We anchored it to the fence and locked the bikes through the vent in the back, which was nice to be able to do. It's ultimately just a heavy duty tent for your stuff. If we weren't renters, I would buy something more substantial, but it works fine for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Tad DeLay

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.text: This works for our needs. It only fits two adult bikes not three. It is basically a heavy duty tent and ours has toppled over a few times for to average winds. We put bricks inside to steady it but it still blew over even with two bikes in there. I guess for the money and portability it’s a good product. I like that it’s not a permanent structure and can fit in smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.author: purple pixy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but not fully waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The material is thick and sturdy. It was easy to assemble. However it is not completely waterproof. It recently stormed hard for 2 days and put down about 6-8 inches of rain in those 2 days. The tent had about a pint of water in the bottom of it when I opened it up today after all of the rain. Pretty good considering how much it rained but if you are looking for 100% waterproof then this isn’t the choice for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Came through Hurricane Irma ok
customer_reviews.text: We just came through hurricane Irma in Florida. Our yardstash IV went through it like a champ. We had it staked down and also tied to a post. It is fine, dry, and we are very happy. I love this and hope to get another one soon. It's easier for us than trying to build a shed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy - well made products.
customer_reviews.text: We had our last Yard Stash for nearly 4 years in the Hot Arizona Sun. It finally tore with the first Monsoon this season. We upgraded to the Heavy Duty one and plan on getting 6 years out of it. Great product for hiding bikes, and seat cushions. Plenty of room with easy of movement.
customer_reviews.author: lraz

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Irma couldn't bring her down!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Palm Beach County Florida and was amazed that this shed withstood the high winds of Irma. I did create a floor using a 6 ft folding table (I didn't want to risk puncturing the floor w/kickstands) which probably helped stabilize it, but there wasn't a mark on it after the storm! I give this 5 thumbs up 👍👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Sansone

customer_reviews.title: quality durability disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Problems with curve zipper from day One. poor designwith curve top and side zippers 90 degee door flap would have served the purpose better. inferior zipper, certainly not heavy duty enough. poor quality or poor design terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Relatively Easy to Set Up, Sturdy backyard storage option
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to set up this shed tent. I needed a place to put my bicycle and 2 kids’ bikes, and this did the trick. It can only hold 2 adult bikes, or one adult bike and some smaller bikes or items in it. It’s not as spacious as the photos would indicate, but it really did the trick for me, enabling me to free up garage space, which made my wife happy and it didn’t cost that much to do.
customer_reviews.author: P. KAT

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I did not build it because I break IKEA furniture when I try but my teen said it was super easy and took 20 mins. It is surprisingly sturdy. I put small bike rack on the floor to keep my bikes standing. Because I have rather large bikes with baskets the secret to fitting them was to put them in opposite directions. In other words, one bike has front wheel and another one had rear wheel in the rack. There is also space to hang some bags on the wall. The zipper glides smoothly and so far my bikes stayed dry in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonka

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for producing the fourth iteration of the YardStash. Item comes well packaged in the handy carrier. It's easy to setup too and the instructions are easy to understand. I truly love the quality of the product however getting my bikes (a full sus 26er and a 27.5er) in and out at times can be a bit tough. But it holds them well in our erratic climate here in Singapore. In my YardStash, I have two full sized bikes, a kick scooter, a floor pump and have a helmet on the well thought out helmet/accessory hook too and there's still space for more items. Probably even another bike but definitely not a mtb.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji Hong

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a month. Looks great. Holds a decent amount (2 adult bikes -- one with a baby seat and 2 child bikes). It has rained multiple times and we have had pretty heavy winds once and have had no issues. Hopefully it will continue to last! For the price, it is a very nice alternative to a shed that requires a foundation and assembly, etc ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 4 star not a 5 for two reasons. One the opening is really difficult to fit a bicycle through to the point it almost collapses every time I try. Second the two top pieces are about 1.5 inches short so they constantly fall out. I think those piece should be longer and the bottom should have pieces that match the top. It's a quality durable fabric and if you weight it down with a particle board base it doesn't fall over as much. I think it's worth it compared to the cost of alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad that the material is tougher on the sides however ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade after neighborhood cats shredded the side of my Yard Stash III. I'm glad that the material is tougher on the sides however I would note that the material that makes up the floor of the III did appear to be stronger than what is on the IV.
customer_reviews.author: stowns

customer_reviews.title: Wow Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very surprised at the quality of the product. The material feels more like a vinyl pool than the weaker tarp material from the big box retailers. If you've ever put up a tent, this will be simple to assemble. The big tests will be surviving snow in the winter and the life of the zippers but at first glance I feel like it should last!
customer_reviews.author: Louie G

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little tricky at first
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be great for me but had a rocky start initially with set up. I did this solo. The poles easily extend but don't lock so just as easily come apart. The product flopped around and swayed quite a bit until I wrestled the poles in their respective places. Best to be done with 2 people. Overall a solid product and I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gem3seeker

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: I have two. One for Christmas stuff and one for yard stuff. Never leaks. Bugs can't get in. Update: Now I have three. Bike's new home.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Frost Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Will collapse if you store more than one bike
customer_reviews.text: Installation is a bit frustrating but I did get it together in less than half an hour. Despite the other reviews and the ad, I would say no more than one bike can fit in here without risking collapse. We managed to squeeze one adult bike and one kid's bike, and it barely closes. Within a month of use, I noticed the poles were starting to buckle and it's leaning against the adjacent structure. That said, I would recommend getting it as long as you're only storing one bike.
customer_reviews.author: AssyrianBooksLLC

customer_reviews.title: Good for storing a bike
customer_reviews.text: I really like the yard stash. Worked great for my beach cruiser. I think two large bikes would be a stretch, But it works great for my purposes. Wish it had bars across the bottom. I tied it to my fence to help keep it upright from wind blowing.
customer_reviews.author: April T.

customer_reviews.title: Good short term and cost friendly solution
customer_reviews.text: I am using it on a porch with tile floors. It came fast and will keep the bikes dry. You need 2 people to assemble. On tile you need to weigh it down with bricks inside and screw to a wall. 2 bikes is a squeeze. Good for the price. If you’re living in a place for long term and can afford it, maybe the big plastic ones would be a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable bicycle tent for fulltime RVers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent portable bicycle tent. I use it around the country at RV Parks to hold my mountain bike and my wife's adult trike. Keeps both dry and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: It was everything advertised but the front zipper handle was broken when It arrived. That makes it kind of a B to open and close. I’m not sending it back though, but they might want to put stronger zipper handles.
customer_reviews.author: Cbomb43

customer_reviews.title: yes 2 full sized adult bikes fit fine, can even toss some smaller stuff in as ...
customer_reviews.text: May rank this higher after it sees and Upstate NY winter. Purchase 1, because I needed a, fast, portable shed to how a snowblower or mower. Just ordered 2 more. These are a lot bigger than you expect, go up fast and can be moved with out taking apart. I will have one for winter stuff, one for summer and one for bikes. And, yes 2 full sized adult bikes fit fine, can even toss some smaller stuff in as well.
customer_reviews.author: snowwovel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Great quality, works exactly as designed, and very sturdy material. I believe we'll be able to store two adult bikes for many years. Dislikes: The directions for assembly could be explained more clearly, the ground stakes are rather flimsy, and when empty the tent blows over easily. Suggested changes: Improve explanation for assembly and make the support poles more sturdy. Overall impression: Terrific product - exactly what we needed and hoped we would get. The "plusses" vastly outweigh the minor "minuses."
customer_reviews.author: Philip Steffes

customer_reviews.title: This is a great storage option
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in July of 2016 and it has remained outside in the elements the entire time. This is a great storage option. Sun, wind and rain have done absolutely no damaged to it or the contents that I have inside. It was easy to assemble and well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: RickNOL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking I will have this cover/shed for my bike for many, many years. The construction is great and the material that it is made from appears to be bomb proof. Would recommend this item that doesn't have a lot to store but wants to keep what is being stored in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Customer service email non-existent
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke after a little over a year. Email address listed on website invalid. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Hari S Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Zippers fail-
customer_reviews.text: The zippers on this product are insufficient. They are self-repairable to a point but eventually teeth come out and they separate. It is a flaw in design. They need heavier gauge zippers. Replacement is possible not it ends up costing over $30 to ship back
customer_reviews.author: Rogeagle

customer_reviews.title: Definitely is not Weather proof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to store the family bicycles. After the first rainstorm, the bottom of the tent filled with water, and became stagnant. I sliced holes in the bottom to drain it, and water still stayed in. If I could return it, I would. So annoyed I blew so much money on this.
customer_reviews.author: JustJoanne7

customer_reviews.title: Nice Portable Storage
customer_reviews.text: Using the storage for a lawn mower and some gardening supplies. It was easy to assemble and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer!
customer_reviews.text: This storage tent is a powerhouse! I used it in the worst rain this past winter and fully expected to find a mess come summer. I was thrilled and amazed to find it BONE DRY inside. A+ product.
customer_reviews.author: dbogowitz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for incredible small portable shed
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed!! We had a horrible storm in the Midwest last night (100mph winds and storm) and the tent held together perfectly and kept everything safe. I was honestly surprised and thrilled! Such good value.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Harmening

customer_reviews.title: Survived typhoons, but not disassembly
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We used it in the Pacific for two years. We put heavy items at the bottom and staked it to the ground. It survived multiple typhoons. Unfortunately, when it was time to move, the poles wouldn’t break down. The metal connectors were severely corroded preventing the poles from coming apart for storage. Still love it. Wish we could buy just new poles!
customer_reviews.author: Tech601

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my stuff, covered in mold from the rain
customer_reviews.text: Worst piece of garbage. All my stuff is covered in mold and it filled with water. I had it since April 27th and have been in and out of town no time to check on this crap and here all my stuff is ruined thanks for wasting $200 I'm thinking of fighting the charge!!! Complete garbage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: and our bikes look like new after almost a year in the tents
customer_reviews.text: I live across the street from the beach and the salt air absolutely destroys my bikes in only a couple of months. Now I have two of these tents, and our bikes look like new after almost a year in the tents.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Tarquin

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to put up almost like a puptent.
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to put up, as a trial run it is packed away until Dec. at which when we'll be leaving for Tenn. and Georgia for the winter months. We will use it once we get there. We will be taking our bikes and use it then.
customer_reviews.author: sarah j Grabendike

customer_reviews.title: Better than hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This was sturdier than I had anticipated. I was able to set it up by myself (67 yr old woman) in less than 30 minutes. Looking forward to having more room in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great portable storage.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly high style, but it does its job exceedingly well - it's not hard to assemble and packs down reasonably small; there's a lot of internal space, and the fabric is heavy-duty; the seams are well-sealed and I've had no issues of leakage. All in all, a more flexible solution than the usual hard-shell deck box.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zipper!
customer_reviews.text: Zipper pulls are cheap and are not strong enough. Mine already broke on 3rd use. Can still close. Not great self standing and needs to be tied to fence, tree or a wall.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Good concept
customer_reviews.text: zippers are not easy. Serves its purpose. Getting my eliptigo bike in is a challenge as it is long and the zipper opening is set in. Fine for two regular bikes.
customer_reviews.author: toniv

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bake tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a good solution for a shed without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Cheerful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Haven't had a really windy storm come through yet, but it looks good and solid, plus it is in a pretty protected area. We put it up on pallets and threw in two bikes, probably could have put in one more with some maneuvering, but decided to weight the bottom down with some misc. summer items. I want to get another for all my Christmas storage, but uncertain how it will do in our 100+ degree summer days.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: not as big as stataed in the description
customer_reviews.text: floor is 30 X 72, Door is two small, a lot of effort required too get full size bikes in through the door. Bikes push out on all 4 sides. will not maintain shape without advance support. Very unstable, zipper gets caught on fabric. Not easy to set up. However, it will keep the water out. Heavy duty material.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Riemer

customer_reviews.title: Great little shed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this storage shed to use at our seasonal campsite for storing chairs, our lawnmower and tools do that they would be secure when not there. it holds a lot and its perfect! You need to lean it on a tree or back of the camper for sturdiness but otherwise it does the job. Bought a small lock to go through the zipperpulls for extra security. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: F Schoonmaker

customer_reviews.title: Fulfills our needs
customer_reviews.text: We live and apt with a de k we keep this on the deck with our bikes and a few extra things we don’t want inside and it’s great. Had several really windy days and it stayed sturdy, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Hyslip

customer_reviews.title: Keeps lawnmower dry.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a very durable product, I’ve had for a few months and it has kept my lawnmower dry and out of my garage. If you are tight on space or have deed restrictions in your neighborhood this product is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. McKee

customer_reviews.title: This product leaks and need a replacement
customer_reviews.text: The tent isn’t suppose to leak? It been raining and there is water inside. Who can I talk to about this to return item and get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and as described. The product is ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and as described. The product is well built and the material is much heavier than I expected and it should perform very well in all weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Carlito Albondigas

customer_reviews.title: Can have variety of uses
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to store exercise equipment and can fit 3 rebounders, 3 steps with lifts, 3 balance ball, yoga mats, free weights As well as jump ropes on the “hooks” inside, had for a few weeks but so far is holding up very well, hope it lasts out through winter.
customer_reviews.author: momma mina

customer_reviews.title: Fits all the essentials
customer_reviews.text: It is sitting in a very torrid climate. Fits a Karcher pressure washer, large container, bicycle car rack, bicycle stand, and a large 29” bicycle. Although you’ll have to slide a big bicycle sideways to make it fit. Waterproof and no issues with rain.
customer_reviews.author: Azmi Afyouni

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different storage tents on the same day. This one, while I didn't like the color at first, has held up to abuse and neglect. It's solid.
customer_reviews.author: Smile.Amazin

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is my second yard stash purchase. I got 5 years out of the last shed, but this vinyl is supposed to be even sturdier. It serves the purpose of storing some excess yard stuff. I only have it a few months...so will see how it does through the winter. It is very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: TOOTSIE

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, there is so much room and it is really made well. Much cheaper then putting up a plastic shed to hold the outside toys. Just wanting to see how it holds up over the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn H.

customer_reviews.title: not worth money
customer_reviews.text: horrible needed to tie back poles to wall for it to stay staple side rods kept falling definitely not worth the money first product that i ever bothered to complain about!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lil Cat

customer_reviews.title: excellent idea
customer_reviews.text: We live on the second floor and have a back porch, which was perfect in size. I keep my folding chairs and table, suitcases, and even a large pack of paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Suri

customer_reviews.title: lost in delivery
customer_reviews.text: it seems to be lost in the delivery....maybe by tomorrow the 29th....or i have to cancel sunday...i have 2 other yard stash sheds....the xl also purchased from amazon.....i like them very much, but one was crushed by a tree recently ...i have yet to get to it, but might need a new frame part.....let you know as soon as i know......thank you so much....love your products...Marianne
customer_reviews.author: marianne kwiatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Extra storage
customer_reviews.text: My old one lasted over 5 years through wind and snow. The new one looks even stronger. Handy for extra storage
customer_reviews.author: msb

customer_reviews.title: Easy directions to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store 2 bikes. I really like the shed, but it would have been easier to store the bikes and remove them if they made the zipper open all the way. That’s my only critique, otherwise I’m quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: amh

customer_reviews.title: A heavy duty tent for our lawn mower ectetera
customer_reviews.text: We are happy with our new Yardstash. It's up storing our lawnmower and a few other yard items making lawn work a little more convenient. Originally we were on a quest for bike store but that got sidetracked. If there is a negative it is that in putting the Yardstash together the directions were not very helpful. We relied on our camping day experiences. Yardstash was a good choice!!! It is sturdy and has an easy heavy duty zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McHie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zipper
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke just after the 30 day return window. Now I’m stuck with a tent that can’t close, will probably have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: TRON-DOG

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, quality material! EASY to set up!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a garage (or it's full) this is a super alternative to store your bike, beach chairs etc. I didn't find it hard to set up and it's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over the prior models with regards to ease of set up and the durability of the material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Word of caution
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to set up this tent, be sure to do it least when the temperature is ABOVE 50° (10° celsius). I tried setting it up and it tore a bit when attaching one of the clips to the vertical support rods; as the material won't stretch. Or maybe build it indoors and then take it out. Also, one of the Roof poles had the elastic rope (that keeps them together) snapped back to the first pole. It took about an hour to get it back through all the 3 poles.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: YardStash Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great concept...We are full time RVers and this is perfect for keeping our bikes clean, dry and safe! Love the quality of material and design.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. No tools needed (it's all tension). The 2 short bars are fiddly, and I'm not sure I have them in correctly. I did spike it down. I have some doubts if it'd withstand a severe, gusty storm, but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn V.

customer_reviews.title: easy assembly - holds 2 bikes
customer_reviews.text: this one was much easier to assemble than the one I had bought 3 years ago...same brand but much better material..it holds 2 bikes easily and a few smaller items like bike air pumps or small garden tools...it sits just below my 6' fence line so my HOA does not have a problem and the fence hides it.... definitely recommend it if you don't want to spend a lot of money on a solid shed...
customer_reviews.author: Ute Appleby

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable...we’ll see...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and can be easily moved if necessary. It is, however, pretty expensive. Interested to see how it holds up this winter.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: It's not a big unit, and doesn't fit well for bikes as it is long enough but can't store more than 2 bikes. Vinyl material is decent, but zipper hard to zip.
customer_reviews.author: PP the Amazon Man

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bikes nice and dry
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be made out of strong material thats been rained on a number of times and is bone dry inside. Overall I am very happy with this purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: and it is a great solution to store our bikes outside
customer_reviews.text: Bought the lighter weight one to store our bikes, we are full time RV'ers, and it is a great solution to store our bikes outside, yet away from the elements. This heavy one seems to weather better in the rain, snow and sun. Like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: DARLYNNLAURIE

product_meta.title: The YardStash IV: Heavy Duty, Space Saving Outdoor Storage Shed Tent
product_meta.description: More affordable, versatile and portable than similarly sized plastic, wood and metal sheds, the new YardStash IV is built entirely of weatherproof, tear proof and UV proof industrial grade vinyl tarpaulin for year round outdoor storage that will stand up to the most extreme conditions. The space-saving (74 inches wide x 32 inches deep x 68 inches high) footprint fits perfectly in tight spaces but is large enough to stash two adult bicycles, outdoor equipment, garden tools, pool toys, patio furniture and other outdoor stuff. Patented roof design to shed rain and snow. Purchase with confidence - the YardStash IV is constructed from high quality materials and guaranteed to last.
feature_bullets: Outdoor bike, gear and tool storage that is more affordable, versatile and portable than similarly sized plastic, wood and metal sheds. Constructed entirely of thick, heavy duty, weatherproof, tear proof, and UV fade proof vinyl tarpaulin, the YardStash IV will stand up to Mother Nature and keep your stuff dry - guaranteed. Built for year round extreme weather conditions and superior durability against UV damage. Beware of cheap imitations!

Space-saving footprint (74 inches wide x 32 inches deep x 68 inches high, fits two adult bikes with room to spare) with integrated floor to stash hard to store stuff like long handled garden tools, furniture cushions, bicycles, lawnmowers, coolers, pool toys & more.

Quick & easy set-up and take down (less than 10 minutes and no tools required) for convenient and portable multi-purpose storage. More affordable, versatile and portable than similarly sized plastic, wood and metal sheds

Rugged large rubber tabbed top and bottom zippers with storm flaps for easy access and full protection against water, dust, and pests. Sealed seams and a new patented snow shedding roof design for four season protection, front mesh vent to eliminate condensation, back Velcro panel for locking bikes to a fence or pole and bottom & back eyelets to attach to ground, fence and/or wall for protection from wind. Includes free carrying bag

What is the difference between the YardStash III and YardStash IV? The YardStash IV is constructed entirely of vinyl tarpaulin while the YardStash III features a vinyl tarpaulin roof and a PVC lined polyester body. The material and roof of the YardStash IV are designed for more extreme weather conditions and the YardStash IV is also two inches deeper than the YardStash III.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars364 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
